intro: Chaenorhinum minus subsp. anatolicum, commonly known as the Anatolian horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to regions of Turkey and the Eastern Mediterranean. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid soils and is adapted to semi-arid climates. Its flowers feature a distinctive horn-like structure at the base of the corolla, giving it its common name. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
